news_header: A proposed law in Colombia aims to ban merchandise celebrating Pablo Escobar, reflecting divided opinions. The bill seeks to prohibit the sale of items promoting criminals, including Escobar, to combat the glorification of his legacy, which is linked to thousands of deaths.
news_original_title: Erasing Escobar: Will Colombia ban the sale of memorabilia of the drug lord?
news_text: While some vendors argue it threatens their livelihoods, supporters believe it is necessary to reshape Colombia's image and honor the victims of drug violence. The bill faces several legislative stages and aims to spark a national conversation about the commercialization of Escobar's image.
